post_info.post_title: Barack Obama cancels meeting with Dalai Lama 'to keep China happy'

China has been buying up U.S debt for years.
 It is in a position now to do the U.S economy harm.
 The U.S will be watching China march into Taiwan in a few years, unable to do anything about it.
 There will be a lot more of Obama kow-towing to China in the years ahead.

 Because it seems he's continuing to dig himself into yet a deeper hole ...
 
 

 
 You should have said another deep hole. Just to name a few:
 
 Healthcare
 Guantanomo
 Iran
 Afghanistan
 North Korea
 Economy
 Unemployment
 
 What really has this President accomplished?
 
 He is almost daily on TV giving one of his eloquent tele prompter speeches, blaming all problems directly or by innuendo on Bush and the republicans.
 He does not seem to have a grasp of economic, military and world political issues. Surrounded by dozens of senior advisors he has become the mouth piece of left wing activists. Fortunately even many of his democratic supporters are wondering whom they have put in the WH. The mid-term election will become an eye opener for this President and the democrats.
 
 The WH just announced that the meeting with Dalai Lama has not been cancelled, it has been postponed! Really?

 He is almost daily on TV giving one of his eloquent tele prompter speeches, blaming all problems directly or by innuendo on Bush and the republicans.

Fortunately even many of his democratic supporters are wondering whom they have put in the WH. The mid-term election will become an eye opener for this President and the democrats.

 
 This was a topic on Hardball with Chris Matthews tonight. He, Pat Buchanan, and others were talking about Obama, and terms like 'prom king' and 'messiah complex' turned up. It was mentioned how the candidate Obama is nothing like president Obama, and how he has been viewed more as someone who takes positions rather than actually being the leader he promised that he would. I thought it was a very fair assessment. 
 
 Kudos for Matthews for being one of the few on MSNBC with the cojones to actually report critically about Obama. It is far too bad that the other Liberal mouthpieces like Maddow and Olberman can't learn a little something from him. Same goes for Beck, Rush, and Hannity. They just can't get past their own partisan hatreds to actually examine the issues fairly.

 In fairness to Beck, Rush, and Hannity...I wouldn't change what the're doing if I were them. Look at the ratings they get. It may be inaccurate but it is entertaining for a number of people. I think Beck is actually a really funny guy...he is half-crazy after all. Most of what he says is not a "fair" assessment but that's why I have the internet :) Rush and Hannity are the same way expect Hannity is annoying with the "you're a great American" bs. Maddow and Olberman are just not entertaining. No creativity or innovation in delivery. At least Bill Maher is funny so I watch that.

 Beck, Rush, and Hannity get te high ratings because FNC is the only conservative "news" media on cable. The problem is that many Americans rely on the above mentioned for their news. Like it or not, these XXXXXX are shaping public opinion via their biased and partisan "reporting". Many Americans (both republican and democrat) are too dumb or lazy to actually find the real news and think for themselves. 
 
 
At least Bill Maher is funny so I watch that.

 
 But Maher actually trys to be a funny man, and in no way touts himself as a journalist...yet he still has a much better grasp of the actual issues than those who many Americans rely on for their news. And yes...Maher is an absolute scream.

 And I don't think it is because they are the only conservative network. They are consistently better entertainment shows. CNN realized this and has tried to copy with many of their shows format (limited success). I'm sure having the monopoly doesn't hurt either but it isn't everything...conservative talk radio has a lot of competition yet all those get insane numbers of ratings.
 
 
But Maher actually trys to be a funny man, and in no way touts himself as a journalist...yet he still has a much better grasp of the actual issues than those who many Americans rely on for their news. And yes...Maher is an absolute scream.
Jon Stewart on the other hand, fails...he is not funny and thinks he is some genius journalist at times.
